alert.note: Alert for Niihau in Kauai (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 20 at 9:13PM HST until February 20 at 11:45PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Kauai in Kauai County * Until 1145 PM HST. * At 913 PM HST, radar showed persistent bands of heavy rainfall moving over Kauai from the southeast with rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour. Water levels have begun to rise in the streams across much of the island, especially in the South Fork Wailua and Hanalei Rivers. Runoff impacting vulnerable low lying areas and roads is likely through the late evening hours. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * This includes the entire island of Kauai. This warning may need to be extended beyond 1145 PM HST if flooding persists. This Flash Flood Warning replaces the previously issued Flood Advisory that was in effect for The island of Kauai in Kauai County. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
